text:
I’ve run into these 2 problems with the include controller in Jmeter 2.1.1:

1) In non-GUI mode, samples from the included JMX do not show up in the test log
at all.

2) In GUI mode, the samples from the included JMX show up in a ‘View Results
Tree’ listener. However, in about 1 in 5 times, they run out of order -- the
included sample precedes a sample that occurs 'above' it. 

Attaching a testcase.
creator: sonam.chauhan@ce.com.au
sonam.chauhan@ce.com.au
text:
Created attachment 19352
Testcase replicating both problems

Zipfile containing 2 JMX files - toplevel.jmx includes included.jmx. Run
toplevel.jmx in GUI mode to see problem #2.  Run in non-GUI mode to see problem
#1.

Problem 1 appears to be solved in the current nightly.

Problem 2 still occurs with the current nightly.

This area of JMeter is rather complicated, so I don't expect the fault will be 
fixed for some while - sorry.
creator: sebb@apache.org
p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Issue 2 still here in JMeter 2.5.1.
Sample HTTP Request 1 occurs twice.

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Created attachment 28497
Test Plan using Test Fragment

Test plan showing it works fine with Test Fragment

Since JMeter 2.5, Test Fragment has been introduced and is the recommanded (and
supported) way of using IncludeController.

Using this solution, the 2 issues mentionned here are fixed.

I close issue as WONTFIX.
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
